source:
This is a blue box.
This is a red box.
This is a green box.

sections.doc_:
## Introduction

The [amp-carousel](/content/amp-dev/documentation/components/reference/amp-carousel-v0.2.md) component allows displaying multiple similar pieces of content along a horizontal axis.
sections.cachedMarkedDoc:
Introduction

The amp-carousel component allows displaying multiple similar pieces of content along a horizontal axis.
sections.normalizedDoc_:
## Introduction

The [amp-carousel](/content/amp-dev/documentation/components/reference/amp-carousel-v0.2.md) component allows displaying multiple similar pieces of content along a horizontal axis.

sections.doc_: Import the carousel component in the header.
sections.normalizedDoc_: Import the carousel component in the header.

sections.code:
<style amp4email-boilerplate>body{visibility:hidden}</style>
<style amp-custom>
  .blue-box, .red-box, .green-box {
    width: 100%;
    height: 280px;
  }
  .blue-box {
    background: blue;
  }
  .green-box {
    background: green;
  }
  .red-box {
    background: red;
  }
  #custom-button .amp-carousel-button-prev {
    left: 5%;
    background-image: url('http://localhost:8080/static/samples/img/carousel-arrow-left.png');
  }
  #custom-button .amp-carousel-button-next {
    right: 5%;
    background-image: url('http://localhost:8080/static/samples/img/carousel-arrow-right.png');
  }
</style>
</head>
<body>

sections.doc_: Use `type="carousel"` to display a list of images as a continuous strip.
sections.code:
<amp-carousel height="300"
  layout="fixed-height"
  type="carousel">
  <amp-img src="http://localhost:8080/static/samples/img/image1.jpg"
    width="400"
    height="300"
    alt="a sample image"></amp-img>
  <amp-img src="http://localhost:8080/static/samples/img/image2.jpg"
    width="400"
    height="300"
    alt="another sample image"></amp-img>
  <amp-img src="http://localhost:8080/static/samples/img/image3.jpg"
    width="400"
    height="300"
    alt="and another sample image"></amp-img>
</amp-carousel>
sections.preview:
<amp-carousel height="300"
    layout="fixed-height"
    type="carousel">
    <amp-img src="http://localhost:8080/static/samples/img/image1.jpg"
      width="400"
      height="300"
      alt="a sample image"></amp-img>
    <amp-img src="http://localhost:8080/static/samples/img/image2.jpg"
      width="400"
      height="300"
      alt="another sample image"></amp-img>
    <amp-img src="http://localhost:8080/static/samples/img/image3.jpg"
      width="400"
      height="300"
      alt="and another sample image"></amp-img>
  </amp-carousel>
sections.normalizedDoc_: Use `type="carousel"` to display a list of images as a continuous strip.

sections.doc_: Use `type="slides"` to display a list of images as slides.
sections.code:
<amp-carousel width="400"
  height="300"
  layout="responsive"
  type="slides">
  <amp-img src="http://localhost:8080/static/samples/img/image1.jpg"
    width="400"
    height="300"
    layout="responsive"
    alt="a sample image"></amp-img>
  <amp-img src="http://localhost:8080/static/samples/img/image2.jpg"
    width="400"
    height="300"
    layout="responsive"
    alt="another sample image"></amp-img>
  <amp-img src="http://localhost:8080/static/samples/img/image3.jpg"
    width="400"
    height="300"
    layout="responsive"
    alt="and another sample image"></amp-img>
</amp-carousel>
sections.preview:
<amp-carousel width="400"
    height="300"
    layout="responsive"
    type="slides">
    <amp-img src="http://localhost:8080/static/samples/img/image1.jpg"
      width="400"
      height="300"
      layout="responsive"
      alt="a sample image"></amp-img>
    <amp-img src="http://localhost:8080/static/samples/img/image2.jpg"
      width="400"
      height="300"
      layout="responsive"
      alt="another sample image"></amp-img>
    <amp-img src="http://localhost:8080/static/samples/img/image3.jpg"
      width="400"
      height="300"
      layout="responsive"
      alt="and another sample image"></amp-img>
  </amp-carousel>
sections.normalizedDoc_: Use `type="slides"` to display a list of images as slides.

sections.doc_: The `autoplay` attribute (`type="slides"` only) advances the slide to the next slide without user interaction, by default it will advance a slide in 5000 millisecond intervals (5 seconds) and can be overridden by the `delay` attribute.
sections.code:
<amp-carousel width="400"
  height="300"
  layout="responsive"
  type="slides"
  autoplay
  delay="2000">
  <amp-img src="http://localhost:8080/static/samples/img/image1.jpg"
    width="400"
    height="300"
    layout="responsive"
    alt="a sample image"></amp-img>
  <amp-img src="http://localhost:8080/static/samples/img/image2.jpg"
    width="400"
    height="300"
    layout="responsive"
    alt="another sample image"></amp-img>
  <amp-img src="http://localhost:8080/static/samples/img/image3.jpg"
    width="400"
    height="300"
    layout="responsive"
    alt="and another sample image"></amp-img>
</amp-carousel>
sections.preview:
<amp-carousel width="400"
    height="300"
    layout="responsive"
    type="slides"
    autoplay
    delay="2000">
    <amp-img src="http://localhost:8080/static/samples/img/image1.jpg"
      width="400"
      height="300"
      layout="responsive"
      alt="a sample image"></amp-img>
    <amp-img src="http://localhost:8080/static/samples/img/image2.jpg"
      width="400"
      height="300"
      layout="responsive"
      alt="another sample image"></amp-img>
    <amp-img src="http://localhost:8080/static/samples/img/image3.jpg"
      width="400"
      height="300"
      layout="responsive"
      alt="and another sample image"></amp-img>
  </amp-carousel>
sections.normalizedDoc_: The `autoplay` attribute (`type="slides"` only) advances the slide to the next slide without user interaction, by default it will advance a slide in 5000 millisecond intervals (5 seconds) and can be overridden by the `delay` attribute.

sections.doc_:
By default, carousel buttons use inlined SVGs as background-images.

You may override these with your own SVGs or images by using `.amp-carousel-button-prev` and `.amp-carousel-button-next` classes.
sections.code:
<amp-carousel id="custom-button"
  width="400"
  height="300"
  layout="responsive"
  type="slides"
  autoplay
  delay="2000">
  <amp-img src="http://localhost:8080/static/samples/img/image1.jpg"
    width="400"
    height="300"
    layout="responsive"
    alt="a sample image"></amp-img>
  <amp-img src="http://localhost:8080/static/samples/img/image2.jpg"
    width="400"
    height="300"
    layout="responsive"
    alt="another sample image"></amp-img>
  <amp-img src="http://localhost:8080/static/samples/img/image3.jpg"
    width="400"
    height="300"
    layout="responsive"
    alt="and another sample image"></amp-img>
</amp-carousel>
sections.preview:
<amp-carousel id="custom-button"
    width="400"
    height="300"
    layout="responsive"
    type="slides"
    autoplay
    delay="2000">
    <amp-img src="http://localhost:8080/static/samples/img/image1.jpg"
      width="400"
      height="300"
      layout="responsive"
      alt="a sample image"></amp-img>
    <amp-img src="http://localhost:8080/static/samples/img/image2.jpg"
      width="400"
      height="300"
      layout="responsive"
      alt="another sample image"></amp-img>
    <amp-img src="http://localhost:8080/static/samples/img/image3.jpg"
      width="400"
      height="300"
      layout="responsive"
      alt="and another sample image"></amp-img>
  </amp-carousel>
sections.normalizedDoc_:
By default, carousel buttons use inlined SVGs as background-images.
 You may override these with your own SVGs or images by using `.amp-carousel-button-prev` and `.amp-carousel-button-next` classes.

sections.doc_: Each of these nodes may also have arbitrary HTML children.
sections.code:
This is a blue box.
This is a red box.
This is a green box.
sections.preview:
This is a blue box.
This is a red box.
This is a green box.
sections.normalizedDoc_: Each of these nodes may also have arbitrary HTML children.

sections.doc_: A good use case for `amp-carousel` are image galleries, [here](/documentation/examples/multimedia-animations/image_galleries_with_amp-carousel/) are some examples.
sections.normalizedDoc_: A good use case for `amp-carousel` are image galleries, [here](/documentation/examples/multimedia-animations/image_galleries_with_amp-carousel/) are some examples.

document.head:
<meta charset="utf-8">
  <script async src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0.js"></script>
  <script async custom-element="amp-carousel" src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0/amp-carousel-0.1.js"></script>
  <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width,minimum-scale=1,initial-scale=1"><style amp-boilerplate>body{-webkit-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;-moz-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;-ms-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both}@-webkit-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-moz-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-ms-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-o-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}</style><noscript><style amp-boilerplate>body{-webkit-animation:none;-moz-animation:none;-ms-animation:none;animation:none}</style></noscript>
document.title: amp-carousel
document._description: The amp-carousel component allows displaying multiple similar pieces of content along a horizontal axis.
